results.title: Better living through circuitry [DVD]
results.brief_description: Although directed by John Reiss,Better Living Through Circuitry’ is a collaborative documentary exploring the evolution of theRave’ counter-culture with particular focus on the American scene. It explores the technological and musical evolutions with artists, Kraftwerk,Genesis p. Orridge, Carl Cox, the Crystal Method and also more contemporary experimentalists like Scanner. The D>I>Y sampling techniques have recreated the means and understanding of musical perception. Very much a postmodern exploration,yet the psychedelic focus still somewhat reminiscent of thehippie’ revolution of the late 60’s. BLTC explores how raves and warehouse parties ascribe to letting go of inhibitions,social mores and prejudices of mainstream society. They exist as a communally creative release allowing individualism and the celebration of altered states. The film draws parallels with ancient tribal and ritualistic gatherings. Using flash photic light and patterned low wave pulse frequencies,the trance state generates a metabolic connection in the Beta Brain State. More than anything,Better Living Through Circuitry’ is an announcement to the world that tribal rituals and spirituality are alive and well in an age of technological dominance.

results.title: Better dairying
results.brief_description: Produced for Cyclone fencing, this film looks at the value of tubular steel and wire mesh in farm buildings, fencing and gates on dairy farms, especially the savings in labour and maintenance costs. The uses of steel fencing and prefabricated steel sheds are described, followed by a complete milking unit in operation. The film closes with an analysis of capital costs, savings and earnings from increased yields.

results.title: Better business letters
results.brief_description: A training video with an accompanying trainers manual designed to teach better letter writing techniques for business. A number of techniques are covered along with tips on writing clearly and persuasively. The video also points out common misuses of words and expressions and offers several methods for getting letters started.

results.title: Betsy's wedding
results.creator_credit: Alan Alda, Martin Bregman, Louis A. Stroller and Touchstone Pictures
results.brief_description: Directed by Alan Alda, “Betsy’s wedding” is about a father (Alda) who must survive his daughter’s wedding, with all its fractious factions, complications, cost, deal making and emotional turmoil. An intermittently amusing work, with the highlight being Anthony La Paglia’s turn as a mobster’s nephew who falls for the bride’s policewoman sister. Cast also includes Joey Bishop, madeline Kahn, Molly Ringwald, Joe Pesci, Ally Sheedy.

results.title: Betrayed by a handprint
results.creator_credit: D.W. Griffith and American Mutoscope and Biograph Company
results.brief_description: Society lady turned thief gets caught out when she leaves her hand print at the scene of the crime. Cast includes Florence Lawrence, Harry Solter, Linda arvidson, Kate Bruce, Gene Gauntier, George Gebhardt, Mack Sennett. Silent film with English intertitles.

results.title: Bethune
results.creator_credit: Donald Brittain, John Kemeny and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description: A documentary on the life of Dr Norman Bethune, who opened up Spain’s first blood bank during the Spanish Civil War, and went to China where he acted as doctor on the famous “long march”. Using graphic film clips, stills and interviews with colleagues Dr Bethune’s legendary career is presented.
